thread.title: Dinesh D’Souza Says Literal “Good Riddance” After Trump Fires US Attorney Who Jailed Him
thread.title_full: Dinesh D’Souza Says Literal “Good Riddance” After Trump Fires US Attorney Who Jailed Him

author: K. Campbell
title: Dinesh D’Souza Says Literal “Good Riddance” After Trump Fires US Attorney Who Jailed Him
text:
Small Coal-Mining Town Makes Comeback Under Trump Presidency 
He also called the ousted prosecutor an “obstructionist,” explaining that when he finally was able to look at his case file, Bharara’s prosecutors had notes about D’Souza being a conservative critic of Obama — something that should have been irrelevant to a campaign finance prosecution. THE OBSTRUCTIONIST: @PreetBharara tried to block a congressional oversight committee from seeing my case file–but now they have it 
— Dinesh D'Souza (@DineshDSouza) March 13, 2017 
D’Souza said Bharara’s prosecutors even reportedly laughed at him during his sentencing. and had an office pool going for how long they could get him locked up. 
Now, D’Souza is the one who is laughing. 
“AS THE WORLD TURNS: Once I was in confinement & @PreetBharara was laughing; now he’s unemployed & I’m laughing,” D’Souza tweeted. AS THE WORLD TURNS: Once I was in confinement & @PreetBharara was laughing; now he's unemployed & I'm laughing pic.twitter.com/7WrBp8c2jD 
— Dinesh D'Souza (@DineshDSouza) March 13, 2017 
D’Souza definitely has good reason to rejoice in Bharara’s firing, as do the rest of us who appreciate the idea of federal prosecutors who don’t let politics influence their decisions. 
Like and share this article on Facebook and Twitter if you agree with Dinesh D’Souza that Preet Bharara’s firing is a good thing. What do you think about D’Souza’s claims against Bharara? Scroll down to comment below! Advertisement Popular Right Now
